com.googlecode.mrsqg.mrs
Class MRS

java.lang.Object
  com.googlecode.mrsqg.mrs.MRS

public class MRS
extends java.lang.Object

An MRS representation class.

Naming convention:
In an example EP:
[
_poet_n_1_rel<4:8>
LBL: h10
ARG0: x6 [ x PERS: 3 NUM: SG IND: + ]
]
type(EP) label: _poet_n_1_rel
feature: LBL/ARG0
value: h10/x6
extra type: [ x PERS: 3 NUM: SG IND: + ]
extra feature: PERS/NUM/IND
extra value: 3/SG/+

Author:
Xuchen Yao

public com.googlecode.mrsqg.mrs.ElementaryPredication getEPbyLabel(java.lang.String label)

getEPShandleList

public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getEPShandleList()
get a list of the handles of all EPs In an EP like: [ _like_v_1_rel<5:10> LBL: h8 ARG0: e9 ARG1: x6 ARG2: x10 ] h8 is label. e9, x6, x10 are handles

Returns:
an ArrayList containing all the handles of EPS

getEPbefore

public com.googlecode.mrsqg.mrs.ElementaryPredication getEPbefore(int cfrom,
                                                                  int cto)
Get the EP before cfrom and cto. This method is mainly used to find out the preposition before a time/location term. For instance, "in Germany", one EP is _IN_P_REL ("in"), the other is PROPER_Q_REL ("Germany"), feeding cfrom and cto with those of PROPER_Q_REL returns the _IN_P_TEMP_REL EP.

getExtraTypeByFeatAndValue

public com.googlecode.mrsqg.mrs.FvPair getExtraTypeByFeatAndValue(java.lang.String feat,
                                                                  java.lang.String value)
find out an extra type whose extra feature/value match feat and value.

Parameters:
feat - the name of extra feature, such as "ARG0"
value - the name of extra value, such as "e2"
Returns:
a matching FvPair

hi_vid - "1"

getLoLabelFromHconsList

public static java.lang.String getLoLabelFromHconsList(java.lang.String hiLabel,
                                                       java.util.ArrayList<com.googlecode.mrsqg.mrs.HCONS> list)
Given a hiLabel, check the corresponding loLabel in the list. For instance, the list contains a "h1 qeq h2" relation, then given a hiLabel "h1", the function returns the loLabel "h2"

Parameters:
hiLabel - a hiLabel
list - a list possibly containing the loLabel
Returns:
a corresponding loLabel in the list, or null if not found

getHiLabelFromHconsList

public static java.lang.String getHiLabelFromHconsList(java.lang.String loLabel,
                                                       java.util.ArrayList<com.googlecode.mrsqg.mrs.HCONS> list)
Given a loLabel, check the corresponding HiLabel in the list. For instance, the list contains a "h1 qeq h2" relation, then given a loLabel "h2", the function returns the hiLabel "h1"

Parameters:
loLabel - a loLabel
list - a list possibly containing the hiLabel
Returns:
a corresponding hiLabel in the list, or null if not found

changeFromUnkToNamed

public void changeFromUnkToNamed()
When FSC is input to cheap, NEs are labeled as NAMED_UNK_REL, which generates the following error in LKB generation: Warning: invalid predicates: |named_unk_rel("Washington DC")| Changing named_unk_rel to NAMED_REL solves this (hopefully).

getExtrapair

public java.util.ArrayList<java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> getExtrapair()
Get all the extra pairs in this MRS. Extra pairs are sth. like: [TENSE: PRES] encoded in XML: TENSEPRES

Returns:
an ArrayList of all extra pairs

setAllSF2QUES

public void setAllSF2QUES()
Set the sentence force of all events variables to "QUES". Theoretically only the events of predicates should be set, but practically all of them are set.

extractByLabel

public static MRS extractByLabel(java.lang.String label,
                                 MRS mrs)
extract a new MRS from mrs, containing only EPs that are associated with label. currently, the label should only of a predicate's label. for instance, an EP looks like: [ _like_v_1_rel<5:10> LBL: h8 ARG0: e9 ARG1: x6 ARG2: x10 ] then all EPs with x6 and x10 as ARG0 are extracted. Those EPs make a new MRS.

Parameters:
label - the label of the predicate
mrs - the original mrs to be extracted from
Returns:
a new MRS with only EPs concerning label

getAllReferredLabelByEP

public java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> getAllReferredLabelByEP(com.googlecode.mrsqg.mrs.ElementaryPredication ep)
An EP refers to other EPs by the ARG* values. This method retrieves the labels of all EPs which are referred by the ARG* values of ep.

Parameters:
ep - An EP which has ARG* entries
Returns:
a HashSet of labels referred by the ARG* of this ep

removeEP

public boolean removeEP(com.googlecode.mrsqg.mrs.ElementaryPredication ep)
remove ep from the EPS list

Parameters:
ep - the ep to be removed
Returns:
success status

remove h from the hcons list

Parameters:
h - the HCONS to be removed
Returns:
success status

toMRXstring

public java.lang.String toMRXstring()
get a string containing an MRX

Returns:
a one-line string with an element

toXML

public void toXML(java.io.OutputStream os)

buildCoref

public void buildCoref()
This method builds cross references for an MRS representation. After reading/parsing an MRX, such arguments (such as "x9) are referenced individually. This method make them refer to the same one.

parse

public void parse(java.io.File file)
This method parses a MRS document in XML, then calls buildCoref().

Parameters:
file - an MRS XML fil

parseString

public void parseString(java.lang.String str)
This method parses a MRS document in a string, then calls buildCoref().

Parameters:
str - a string containing an MRS structure

getMrxStringsFromCheap

public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getMrxStringsFromCheap(java.lang.String multiline)
Use RegEx to match all in a multiline string

Parameters:
multiline - cheap output spreading multilines
Returns:
an array list containing all elements

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
